conclusion: To determine the position at t = 8 seconds, calculate the area under the v-t graph from t = 0 to t = 8 seconds.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the particle.
Initial position: The particle starts at x = 5 meters.
Segment 1: t = 0 to t = 1 seconds shows a triangle with a base of 1 second and a height of 2 m/s.
Segment 2: t = 1 to t = 3 seconds has a constant velocity of 2 m/s for 2 seconds.
Segment 3: t = 3 to t = 4 seconds shows a triangle with a base of 1 second and a height of 2 m/s, velocity decreases to 0.
Segment 4: t = 4 to t = 5 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 0 to -1 m/s.
Segment 5: t = 5 to t = 7 seconds has a constant velocity of -1 m/s for 2 seconds.
Segment 6: t = 7 to t = 8 seconds shows a triangle with a base of 1 second and a height of -1 m/s, velocity increases to 0.
Total displacement: Sum of all areas = 1 + 4 + 1 - 0.5 - 2 - 0.5 = 3 meters.
Final position: Initial position 5 meters + total displacement 3 meters = 8 meters.
